sen.j: 稲荷駅（いなりえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Located in Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Inari Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Inari Station, located in Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Inari Station, located in the Fushimi ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅。
sen.e: It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Muncipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Muncipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.

sen.j: 伏見稲荷大社（おいなりさん）への最寄り駅であり、正月には、参拝客輸送対応として、普段停車しない快速列車が臨時停車する。
sen.e: This is nearest station to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine (Oinari-san) and come New Year, rapid trains which ordinarily do not stop make temporary stops at this station to cope with the problem of transporting the large number of worshipers,

This is nearest station to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine (Oinari-san), and come New Year the rapid trains, which ordinarily do not stop, make temporary stops at this station in order to cope with the challenge of transporting the large numbers of worshipers,

This is the nearest station to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine (Oinari-san), and during the New Year holidays the rapid trains, which ordinarily do not stop, make temporary stops at this station in order to cope with the challenge of transporting the large numbers of worshipers.
sen.cmt: the追加, during the New Year holidaysとしました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅で、ややホームがカーブしている。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two rather curved platforms opposite each other and double tracks.
It is an above-ground station with double tracks and two rather curved platforms opposite each other.
It is an above-ground station with double tracks and two rather curved platforms opposite each other.

sen.j: 駅舎は2番ホーム（下り）側にあり、反対側の1番ホーム（上り）へは跨線橋で連絡している。
sen.e: The station building is on the side of outbound Track #2 platform and connected to inbound Track #2 platform by a passengers' overpass.
The station building is on the side of outbound Track #2 platform and is connected to inbound Track #2 platform by a passengers' overpass.
The station building is on the side of outbound Platform 2 and is connected to the inbound Platform 1 by a passengers' overpass.

sen.j: なお駅業務は（株）ジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR-West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅であり、ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: ICOCA Cards and J Through Cards can be used at this station and PiTaPa Cards (Surutto Kansai Association) subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cards can also be used.
ICOCA cards and J Through cards can be used at this station, and PiTaPa cards (Surutto Kansai Association) can also be used subject to combined use with ICOCA cards.
ICOCA cards and J-Thru cards can be used at this station, and PiTaPa Cards (Surutto KANSAI Association) can also be used subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards.
sen.cmt: J-Thruとしました。 既出の記事と合わせ、subjet to mutual useとしました。

sen.j: 伏見稲荷大社参拝の最寄り駅ということもあり、それを意識してか駅の柱が一部朱色に塗られている。
sen.e: Inari station is the nearest station to go to and worship at the Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine and the station, aware of the circumstances for one thing, has some of its pillars painted vermilion.
sen.cmt: "一部"が数ある柱のうちの一部か、個々の柱の一部分か詳らかでありません。
sen.e: Inari Station is the nearest station in order to go and worship at Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, and the station, aware of the circumstances, has some of its pillars painted vermilion.
Inari Station is the nearest station in order to go and worship at Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine, and the station, aware of the circumstances, has some of its pillars painted vermilion.

sen.j: また、構内には、かつてこの駅が東海道本線の駅であった名残の、国鉄最古のランプ小屋（準鉄道記念物）が現存している。
sen.e: The oldest of Japan National Railways lamp sheds (quasi railroad monument,) a reminder of this station's being a Tokaido Main Line station in by-gone days exists within station premises.
The oldest of the Japan National Railways lamp sheds (quasi-railroad monument), a reminder of this station's legacy as a Tokaido Main Line station in bygone days, exists within the station premises.
The oldest of the Japan National Railways lamp sheds (quasi-railroad monument), a reminder of this station's legacy as a Tokaido Main Line station in bygone days, exists within the station premises.

sen.j: 入場も可能だが、事前に宇治駅 (JR西日本)（管理駅）に予約を入れておく必要がある。
sen.e: Admission is also possible, but booking in advance with Uji Station (JR-West,) the administrative station, is required.
Admission is also possible, but booking in advance with Uji Station (JR-West,) the administrative station, is required.
Admission is also possible, but booking in advance with Uji Station (JR West), the administrative station, is required.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Usage status
Usage status

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約5,233人である。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station in fiscal 2006 was approximately 5,233 per day.
sen.cmt: “約”はここでも“平均”を指す/意味すると思われます。
sen.e: The number of passengers getting on at this station in fiscal 2006 was approximately 5,233 per day.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 5,233 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: (Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 正月には初詣客で大混雑となるため、臨時窓口の設置、快速の臨時停車や列車の増発で対処している。
sen.e: Measures such as installing extra windows, temporary stopping rapid trains and mobilizing extra trains are taken to cope with the extreme congestion in January created by the worshipping crowd.

Measures such as installing extra windows, temporarily stopping rapid trains and mobilizing extra trains are taken in order to cope with the extreme congestion in January created by the crowds of worshipers.

Measures such as installing extra windows, temporarily stopping rapid trains and mobilizing extra trains are taken in order to cope with the extreme congestion during the New Year holidays created by the crowds of worshipers.
sen.cmt: during the New Year holidaysとしました。

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
Station surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 駅を出るとすぐ、伏見稲荷大社への参道が続く。
sen.e: Exiting the station immediately connects to the approach to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine.
Exiting the station immediately connects to the approach to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine.
Exiting the station immediately connects to the approach to Fushimi Inari Taisha Shrine.

sen.j: 伏見稲荷駅（京阪本線） -- 西に徒歩5分ほど。
sen.e: Fushimi-Inari Station (Keihan Main Line)--some 5min. on foot to the west.
Fushimi-Inari Station (Keihan Main Line)--some five minutes on foot to the west
Fushimi-Inari Station (Keihan Main Line)--some five minutes on foot to the west

sen.j: 深草駅（京阪本線） -- 南南西に徒歩7分ほど。
sen.e: Fukakusa Station (Keihan Main Line)--some 7min. on foot S.S.W.
Fukakusa Station (Keihan Main Line)--some seven minutes on foot south-southwest
Fukakusa Station (Keihan Main Line)--some seven minutes on foot south-southwest

sen.j: 龍谷大学深草キャンパス
sen.e: Ryukoku University Fukakusa Campus
Ryukoku University Fukakusa Campus
Ryukoku University Fukakusa Campus

sen.j: 立命館高等学校・立命館中学校
sen.e: Ritsumeikan Senior High School, Ritsumeikan Junior High School
Ritsumeikan Senior High School, Ritsumeikan Junior High School
Ritsumeikan Senior High School, Ritsumeikan Junior High School

sen.j: 京都市立伏見工業高等学校 -- ドラマ「スクール☆ウォーズ」の舞台となった事で知られる。
sen.e: Kyoto City Fushimi Technical Senior High School is known for its having been the stage of the drama 'School Wars.'
Kyoto City Fushimi Technical Senior High School is known for its having been the stage of the drama 'School Wars.'
Kyoto Municipal Fushimi Technical Senior High School is known for its having been the stage of the drama 'School Wars.'
sen.cmt: 他と合わせ、municipalとしました。

sen.j: 伏見稲荷郵便局
sen.e: Fushimi-Inari Post Office
Fushimi-Inari Post Office
Fushimi-Inari Post Office

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1879年、後に東海道本線となる京都-大谷間が開業した際に開設された。
sen.e: Inaugurated in 1879 when the section between Kyoto and Otani which later became a part of theTokai Main Line commenced operations.
It was inaugurated in 1879 when the section between Kyoto and Otani (which later became a part of the Tokai Main Line) commenced operations.
It was inaugurated in 1879 when the section between Kyoto and Otani (which later became a part of the Tokaido Main Line) commenced operations.

sen.j: 翌年には大谷から大津まで延伸、1889年には新橋-神戸間が全通し東海道本線の駅となった。
sen.e: Extended from Otani to Otsu in 1889 and became a station on the Tokaido Main Line when the entire Line between Shimbashi and Kobe saw completion.
It was extended from Otani to Otsu in 1889 and became a station on the Tokaido Main Line when the entire line between Shimbashi and Kobe saw its completion.
It was extended from Otani to Otsu the following year, and in 1889 it became a station on the Tokaido Main Line when the entire line between Shimbashi and Kobe reached completion.

sen.j: 1921年に東海道本線の馬場（現在の膳所駅）-京都間が東山トンネル経由の現在線に切り替えられ、同時に残る京都-稲荷間が桃山駅からの奈良線の新線と接続され同線に編入（詳細は奈良線を参照のこと）。
sen.e: In 1921, the route of the section between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto on the Tokaido Main Line was switched to the present day via Higashiyama Tunnel route and, at the same time, the section between Kyoto and Inari connected to the new Line of the Nara Line from Momoyama Station and incorporated into it (refer to Nara Line for details.)

In 1921, the section of the route between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto on the Tokaido Main Line was switched to the present day via the Higashiyama Tunnel route and, at the same time, the section between Kyoto and Inari connected to the new line of the Nara Line from Momoyama Station and was incorporated into it (refer to "Nara Line" for details).

In 1921, the section of the route between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto on the Tokaido Main Line was switched to its present form via the Higashiyama Tunnel route and, at the same time, the remaining section between Kyoto and Inari was connected to the new line of the Nara Line from Momoyama Station and was incorporated into it (refer to "Nara Line" for details).

sen.j: 以来、稲荷駅は奈良線の駅となった。
sen.e: Ever since then, Inari Station became a Nara Line station.
Ever since then, Inari Station has been a Nara Line station.
Ever since then, Inari Station has been a Nara Line station.

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）8月18日 後に東海道本線となる京都-大谷間の駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Aug. 18, 1879 as a station between Kyoto and Otani which, in later years, became a part of theTokaido Main Line.
Inaugurated on Aug. 18, 1879 as a station between Kyoto and Otani, which, in later years, became a part of the Tokaido Main Line.
August 18, 1879: The station was inaugurated as a station between Kyoto and Otani, which in later years became a part of the Tokaido Main Line.

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）8月1日 東海道本線の経路変更に伴い、奈良線の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Nara Line station on Aug. 1, 1921 when a change was made to the route of Tokaido Main Line.
It became a Nara Line station on Aug. 1, 1921 when a change was made to the route of the Tokaido Main Line.
August 1, 1921: The station became a Nara Line station when a change was made to the route of the Tokaido Main Line.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化に伴い、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 incidental to split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 incidental to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station incidental to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 第1回近畿の駅百選に選定されている。
sen.e: Elected as one of the Most Famous Stations in the Kinki Region at the first of such selections.
It was voted one of the Most Famous Stations in the Kinki Region at the first of such selections.
It was voted one of the Most Famous Stations in the Kinki Region at the first of such selections.

sen.e: Tofukuji Station still had not opened when this station was on the Tokaido Main Line.
